result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose L. Colon

records.addlTxt: NO RECORD MADE.  Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State. Attorney Rose appears on behalf of the DE.   Clerk. M.Burke. Trailing 20CF241 to 12/19/22 at 1:15 and 01/04/23 at 8:30.
No Record Taken: Case will trail 20CF241

Defendant, Jose L. Colon, appeared with Attorney Christopher William Rose.   Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Rose states the DE does not need an interpreter and withdraws request.        DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on May 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:05 PM 
  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Chris Rose.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 5/24/22 @ 930am.  Bond is continued.  Atty rose requesing span int for next hrg.   jk

Status conference on May 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant, Jose L. Colon, appeared.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes: DE appears to be eligible for SPD Attorney as attempts have been made to find appointment per report although report states he is not eligible also. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
SPD has not secured representation
Order on petition for appointment of attorney; denied because there is no indication from SPD that he is not eligible for their services.
Proposed Order sent to JA/ Judge for signature.
